summary: This bill, the Regional Leadership in Wildland Fire Research Act of 2025, mandates the Secretary of Commerce to establish regional wildland fire research centers across the US. These centers, in collaboration with the Administrator of NOAA and the Chief of the Forest Service, will conduct research to understand and mitigate wildland fires. The bill defines various terms, outlines selection criteria for the research centers, and sets up a National Center Coordination Board and Regional Advisory Boards. It also authorizes appropriations for the centers and the board, aiming to improve wildland fire management and safety.
